results.title: Mechanisms of non-verbal communication in the young child
results.brief_description: Looks at ways in which young children aged from eighteen months to three years communicate with each other, and shows the influence of the home and the mother on the behaviour patterns of children in relation to others.

results.title: Hope is not a method. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Cites and describes seven contraceptive methods with anatomiclaly explicit diagrams. States the advantages and disadvantages of withdrawal, rhythm, spermicidal chemicals, the condom, the diaphragm, the pill, the IUD and sterilization. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Exponents: a study in generalisation
results.creator_credit: Ray Redheffer, Stephen Slocomb, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: Animated symbols are used to explain the powers of a number and the use of the exponent in expanded notation. This film has no dialogue and relies entirely on animated visual illustrations to define exponents.

results.title: Cold water survival
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: University of Victoria scientists have found that those people who accidently die in water, do so as a result of exposure rather than drowning. Hypothermia occurs when the body temperature drops to 80 degrees fahrenheit. In their research, the scientists have also found out how the body loses heat and how this can be minimised, and have designed a life jacket, which by helping to conserve body heat, can prolong life.
results.description: University of Victoria scientists have found that those people who accidently die in water, do so as a result of exposure rather than drowning. results.title: An Essay: the popular arts today
results.creator_credit: Saul Bass, Elaine Bass, Jim Ragan and Saul Bass Films
results.brief_description: A vignette on popular arts in America through the use of live-action, animation and special effects. Portrays Hollywood movies as a nightmare realm of casual predation and fatuous pomposity. Focuses also on comic book heros, television, music, books and magazines.
